intro: Anisomeris polyantha, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and a strong, aromatic scent. It produces bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Anisomeris polyantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
